Instead of moving the Knight to c6, geoff has seen that in 2 turns he can get his knight into a more faverable position by moving to d7, then d7-e5 where the pawn defends the knight & the knight has the queen in its sights.
This is an excellent move, forcing the knight to retreat & giving me the oppertunity draw the rook out enough for my Queen to take the easy kill.
